Package com.example.appointment.controller

Class AddCustomerController

java.lang.Object
com.example.appointment.controller.Controller
com.example.appointment.controller.AddCustomerController
All Implemented Interfaces:
AddListenerInterface, AddressCheckInterface, PhoneNumberCheckInterface, PostalCodeCheckInterface, SQLControllerInterface
Direct Known Subclasses:
ModifyCustomerController
public class AddCustomerController extends Controller implements AddListenerInterface, AddressCheckInterface, PostalCodeCheckInterface, PhoneNumberCheckInterface
A controller that loads the Add Customer page allowing users to add new customers to the database.

  • Field Details

    • customerCountryId

      protected Integer customerCountryId

    • customerDivisionId

      protected Integer customerDivisionId

    • reverseCountryHashMap

      protected HashMap<String,Integer> reverseCountryHashMap
      A HashMap that takes in a String of the Country name as a key, and the Country ID as a value. This enables the Country ComboBox to retrieve the country names based on their IDs and allows the division ComboBox to load its divisions based on the Country name.

    • reverseDivisionHashMap

      protected HashMap<String,Integer> reverseDivisionHashMap
      A HashMap that takes in a String of the division name as a key, and the division ID as a value. This enables the Division ComboBox to retrieve the division names based on their IDs.

      public AddCustomerController()

  • Method Details

    • setCustomerComboBoxModel

      public void setCustomerComboBoxModel() throws SQLException, IOException
      Sets the model instance for this controller so that it's using the same model throughout the program.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a SQL database error occurs.
      IOException - If an input/output error occurs.

    • setCustomerController

      public void setCustomerController(ActionEvent event) throws SQLConnectionDroppedException
      A method that calls the methods that set up the TextFields and ComboBoxes for the controller. This is necessary so that each method doesn't have to be called individually.
      Parameters:
      event - Passes in that the button to open the controller was pressed.
      Throws:
      SQLConnectionDroppedException - If a SQL error occurs that disrupts the connection to the database.

    • setCustomerId

      protected void setCustomerId(ActionEvent event) throws SQLConnectionDroppedException
      A method that retrieves the customer ID value from the database. The user does not set the customer ID, it is generated automatically by the program so that if they are 25 items in the database the next item will be #26.
      Parameters:
      event - Passes in the button that was pressed to open the controller.
      Throws:
      SQLConnectionDroppedException - If a SQL error occurs that disrupts the connection to the database.

    • setCustomerCountryComboBox

      public void setCustomerCountryComboBox() throws SQLException, IOException
      A method that loads the customer country ComboBox with values from the database. After the ComboBox gets it values from the setComboBoxValidation method it sorts the values in numerical order.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a SQL database error occurs.
      IOException - If an input/output error occurs.

    • setDivisionComboBox

      public void setDivisionComboBox() throws SQLException, IOException
      A method that loads the customer country ComboBox with values from the database. After the ComboBox gets it values from the setComboBoxValidation method it sorts the values in numerical order.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a SQL database error occurs.
      IOException - If an input/output error occurs.

    • customerAddressCheck

      protected boolean customerAddressCheck(TextField textField)
      A method that validates the customer's address.
      Parameters:
      textField - The Customer Address TextField whose address will be verified.
      Returns:
      true or false depending on the addresses validity.
      See Also:
      • AddressCheckInterface.addressCheck(String, int)

    • saveCustomer

      public void saveCustomer() throws SQLConnectionDroppedException
      A method that saves the customer that was created in the controller to the database.
      Verifying TextFields
      The first thing the method does is verify data from the TextFields.
      These include:
      1. Name
      2. Address
      3. Postal Code
      4. Phone

      These are verified by making sure that their respective TextFields are no empty. If they are the error flag is set to true, and a listener is added to the TextField.
      After the TextFields are verified the method checks the data in the ComboBoxes.
      These include:
      1. Country ComboBox
      2. Division ComboBox

      The divisions cannot be selected until the country is because the available divisions are dependent on what country was selected.
      Next, the following data is added to each customer:
      1. Created by username
      2. Last updated by username
      3. Created by date
      4. Last updated by date
      Because this is a new customer both username values will be the same, and both date values will be the present date and time with time zone information.
      Finally, when all the data has been validated then a customer object will be created that will get passed into the add customer method where it will get added to the database.
      Throws:
      SQLConnectionDroppedException - If a SQL error occurs that disrupts the connection to the database.

    • addCustomer

      public void addCustomer(Customer customer) throws SQLConnectionDroppedException
      A method that takes an Customer object that is created in the saveCustomer() method and then passes the object into the database. After the object has been successfully added to the database it shows an alert message to the user.
      Parameters:
      customer - A passed in customer to be added to the database.
      Throws:
      SQLConnectionDroppedException - If a SQL error occurs that disrupts the connection to the database.
